front.title: The eap.arpa domain and EAP provisioning

abstract.t: This document defines the eap.arpa domain as a way for Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) peers to signal to EAP servers that they wish to obtain limited, and unauthenticated, network access. EAP peers signal which kind of access is required via certain pre- defined identifiers which use the Network Access Identifier (NAI) format of RFC 7542. A table of identifiers and meanings is defined.
